Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Maxine138
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights room 7 top floor, i did not find the stairs a problem. The room was decorated lovely & very spacious for London Accommodation. Could not fault the breakfast at all with many choices, mine being full english. The only faults i could find & this is probably being picky is i could of done with a hand towel for my hair as you only got a bath towel, you have to keep windows shut at night as the traffic from the main road can be a little noisy but slept like a baby once shut. Would really recommend staying here to discover London as great value and friendly staff. I will stay again on my next trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and pretty good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Billysouthwales
Reviews.Content: Booked a double room and paid about £95 for it. This judgement is based on the price I paid for the room in this area. Positives: The room itself was a decent enough size with an en-suite bath / shower. I have paid more for hotels with smaller rooms in the area. Room was nice and clean, which is top of my list of "musts". Tea/coffee are provided. Full english breakfast is provided and gets you off to a good start to the day Negatives: No soap in room, only shampoo (think this was an oversight). No hand towels or floor towels. No lift may cause a problem if you struggle with stairs. Pub downstairs was decent enough. One word of warning though...but nothing to do with the hotel. I parked in the NCP in the Hilton Olympia, approx 50m away. As I arrived at 6.30 PM I had a deal where it would cost £11 to park if I left before 9AM. I got there at 9.15, and was told it would cost £35!!!! It took the guy a phone call to reduce this to a more reasonable £15. I will definitely stay in this hotel again, but will ensure I'm collecting my car before 9AM

Reviews.Title: “Looks great on the surface but scratch it and it reveals big weaknesses”
Reviews.Author: franlong
Reviews.Content: Booked this as many of the reviews seemed ok and close to Olympia - up 2 very large flights of stairs and one of our party had a bad back. Would have been good to know access is for fit people only. First impressions on rooms (we had 4) was wow - this looks amazing - however on closer inspection it looked like they had spent a lot on the refurb and then not bothered with the day to day management of it. My towels were dirty - they smelt like they had been dried and not washed - that horrible unwashed towel smell. When I complained they said they did not understand as all towels went to the laundry. They did however change them. The beds were comfortable and the rooms are decorated very nicely. The bar staff were very pleasant. In Room 4 - you can't fully turn the hot tap on as it is too close to the wall and won't turn more than 90 degrees. In Room 3 half of the tap handles had fallen off and there was no plug in the sink. In room 2 - the bathroom is tiny and not really suitable for anyone who is larger than a size 12 Breakfast was very good but very slow - took 45 minutes from order to food - and there were only 6 of us so if you are in a hurry please be aware of this. The same chap was on duty from Thursday through to Saturday, when we left, and he spent the whole time looking sad and stressed. We were informed breakast was between 7 and 8 so Saturday morning we were all down for 7.50 and breakfast on a weekend is 8-9. They didn't tell us that. So if you need to stay here - be fit and slim - have the time to wait for breakfast and bring your own towels.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Food and Service”
Reviews.Author: Mindless-in-London
Reviews.Content: I took a friend who was travelling in London to this pub for lunch thinking its menu looks very appealing at the door, hoping it will become my local favorite too. There were only two tables including ours in the dining area. Not once any of the staff ask if we needed more drinks nor if ht e food was okay. Service was appalling - no smile nor appreciation. You need to pay for bread. Food was totally lack of seasoning and overcooked. I know I will not be coming back, and will warn all my friends not to bother.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby accommodation”
Reviews.Author: sbsdrive
Reviews.Content: The hotel has got no lift and my room was in third floor. Just at the reception counter the bathroom is located which was quite smelly. Rooms are quite shabby. The wallpapers are torn at some places. My colleagues were in different room and that room had worst wall papers. It looked like there was some leaking through the walls. The single room where i was staying was very small. Good things are the bathroom was fairly clean and the breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as the other reviews would suggest”
Reviews.Author: QueenieBristol
Reviews.Content: I chose the Hand and Flower because it was near to Olympia and the reviews were excellent. However, I was nowhere near as enamoured of this place as those who have given it four and five stars. It is most definitely a pub with some rooms, rather than a hotel. This became obvious when I arrived after a long journey and found the side door to the 'hotel' locked and no one answering the door bell. Eventually I went into the pub and waited to check in while several people were being served drinks. It was all rather off-putting and off-hand. A simple sign on the side door would have been useful. Food, including breakfast, was served in the bar, and although the space was light and airy, as a solo female traveller I just didn't feel comfortable eating dinner surrounded by male drinkers. There were also two screens showing the news, along with background music: all rather intrusive. Other reviews had warned about the number of stairs (78 - I counted!), which was fine, but it felt qutie remote being stuck at the top of the building. The room was quirky in a pleasing way, with its odd shape and old-fashioned furniture, but I ached to move items around to make it work better: a dressing table was stuck under in darkness under the cramped eaves while a chair sat in isolated splendour, for example. Again, the noise had been flagged up in advance, and indeed the TV could not be heard above the traffic if the windows were open, which they had to be as the weather was so warm. There was an attempt to give a 'boutique' feel to the decor, with fashionable wallpaper and colours, but actually it was quite shabby, surprising given the room was around Â£95 per night: part of a tap was missing until the last day, a light was badly fitted, the walls were scuffed, etc. If the price was lower, then this might have been acceptable, but I feel this place is pretending to be something it is not.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE TERRIBLE HOTEL - ABSOLUTELY AWFUL MANAGEMENT”
Reviews.Author: Rachel12348
Reviews.Content: Staff were simply RUDE and very unhelpful!!!! MICE IN THE BAR DOWNSTAIRS!!!!! I had one under my table as I ate. When I complained to bar staff, they made it clear that it was not unusual to see mice in the bar!!!???!!! Do NOT stay there

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SparkleB
Reviews.Content: Booked Hand and Flower for a business trip. We were on a budget and needed to be reasonably close to Chelsea Football ground. Room was spacious with some nice touches - toiletries, above average selection of beverages and biscuits provided plus bottled water. Also ear plugs but didn't need them. Great bathroom. Comfortable bed and great pillows which is rare in most hotels including those costing a lot more. We were made to feel welcome on arrival. We arrived after 9.00 pm which was last orders for food but they were happy to take our order which was very welcome as we had had a long journey. Typical pub grub menu. More than adequate selection of breakfast items. Helpful staff. Would definite stay again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “If you know what to expect, then it's fine”
Reviews.Author: dontlikecities
Reviews.Content: Picked hotel as we were attending a trade show at Olympia - is directly opposite and has pelican crossing almost right outside so easy to get across the busy road - are 53 steps up to the first rooms (2 long flights and 1 small) but very wide. Room very odd mix of dark old fashioned dressing table and attempt at more modern artwork on walls. One wardrobe door had no handle and the doors had to be kept shut using piece of folded card (already supplied) but was spacious enough (take your own coathangers) - bathroom door didn't stay shut - hole in ceiling where they'd fitted spot lights and then decided to move one - bathroom taps each had one 'prong' missing and no top to the plug release - overhead shower couldn't be adjusted at all and didn't work very well however is a second one (for washing hair?) that was brilliant and powerful (but you just had to hold it) - road is noisy but not that bad during the night and you soon get used to it anyway, just don't expect a long quiet lie in the next morning - reading this makes it sound a bit negative however we will probably stay there again next year - bed was so comfortable and the place was clean which are the main things - the rest you just need to laugh at and move on - food was pretty good but we made the mistake of trying to eat the first night about 6.30 - place was packed and couldn't get a seat but next night by 7.15 it was semi empty again - seems everyone leaves olympia after the trade show and goes straight in for a drink! - there is a pizza express across the road which was very quiet and food was great. Staff were very friendly and breakfast was great - said it was served from 7 to 9 so should suit most people. Only other problem was that the dressing table was in front of the heater so it didn't give out much heat when it worked but didn't work some of the time as well - we fortunately packed fleecy dressing gowns so it wasn't a problem. Nice touches - there was ear plugs by the bed and also a bottle of water each (new one each day no matter how much you'd used), 4 coffee, 2 tea, 1 horlicks, 1 chocolate drink and 2 packs of biscuits along with sugar and milk/cream. They've tried ...but failed a bit.... but if you know what to expect, then it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Ok as a change from impersonal london hotel”
Reviews.Author: bettybell
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when working in hammersmith. Didn't eat dinner as arrived late but Bar area lively but comfortable. Lots of sofas as well as chairs. Football on inn one area. My breakfast was excellent. Room disappointing - once you leave the bar area the staircase up to rooms is very rough and ready - needs a new carpet and paint job! My room was on toip floor - seriously high staircase! I know I booked a single but you couldn't swing a cat! Bed was hidden in alcove with no headboard and couldn't see anything as no light in that part of the room. Room a strange mix of old and new style. Bit of a botch job. In contrast, the bathroom , tho also small was fitted out beautifully. I believe the larger double rooms are much better from colleagues. Change from impersonal hotel for same price. Would probably stay again in a different room. Virtually opposite Olympia so excellent location, tube close by too.

Reviews.Title: “Cracked toilet seat and breakfast troubles”
Reviews.Author: Katongo
Reviews.Content: If you want to see London on a budget, then this is a fantastic location. It is within walking distance to South Kensington underground and virtually on top of Kensington Olympia station. If you can sleep through the sound of trains and police sirens then you will love the comfortable beds. The rooms have been decorated in a tasteful fashion and the bathrooms are clean and modern. The toilet seat in my room was cracked which was an obvious concern. The rooms are all situated above a pub, which has a function room. If there is an event on, it could be pretty noisy. To get to the rooms, you have to climb lots of stairs, so travel light. If you are there on business and want an early breakfast e.g. before eight o'clock then you will go hungry. You can get cereal and milk, but nothing cooked until the chef arrives.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Mit_and_biny
Reviews.Content: A couple ofminutes walk from the Kensington Olympia tube station, the b&b is next door to the pub of the same name. There are quite a few stairs so definitely wouldn't recommend it for people who will have trouble climbing them/have pushchairs. A maid outside our room stroppily informed us she hadn't finished cleaning our room, but didn't return to attend to anything in room. However, the room was large, had a lovely en suite with fab shower and clean towels, a gorgeous comfy bed with lots of cushions and a wall mounted lcd tv. Little bottles of water and ear plugs were also laid out. We were staying in the very top room and didn't experience any noise. Breakfast was lovely but as we are veggie and couldn't eat the bacon/sausages, we felt larger portions of the non meat food could've been provided. Most of the buffet items weren't available. Overall, a convenient location and modern well equipped rooms. Staff were polite enough but I can see how some customers may feel they were not heklpful/friendly enough.
